error.regex: (?:Agent.*is offline|node.*is offline|Waiting for next available executor|pending.*No nodes|There are no nodes with the label)

verdict.summary: Jenkins build jobs are stuck waiting because the assigned agent node is offline, unreachable, or no agents match the required label. Builds queue indefinitely until an agent becomes available.

dead_ends.action: Repeatedly restart the Jenkins controller to force agent reconnection
dead_ends.why_fails: Controller restarts disrupt all running jobs and do not fix the underlying agent connectivity or provisioning issue

dead_ends.action: Remove the agent label requirement from the pipeline
dead_ends.why_fails: Running builds on any available node may cause failures due to missing tools, wrong OS, or insufficient resources

workarounds.action: Check agent connectivity and restart the agent service on the node
workarounds.how: SSH into the agent machine, verify the Jenkins agent process is running, check network connectivity to the controller, and restart the agent service: 'systemctl restart jenkins-agent'

workarounds.action: Configure cloud-based auto-scaling agents (Kubernetes, EC2, Docker)
workarounds.how: Install the Kubernetes or EC2 Fleet plugin, configure a cloud agent template that auto-provisions agents on demand when builds queue. Set idle timeout to clean up unused agents

leads_to.condition: When agent comes back online but workspace from previous build is still locked

preceded_by.condition: When workspace issues caused agent to be manually taken offline

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Jenkins agent offline is specific to Jenkins nodes; GitLab runner stuck refers to GitLab CI runner registration/connectivity
